resources.string: This device no longer belongs to this ID. The ID will be disabled on this device and moved to trash. You have to restore it in order to use it again.
Device no longer belongs to ID.
" This ID is no longer available and has been disabled."
A SecSign ID with the user short name already exists.
"A SecSign ID with the user short name doesn't exist on the server."
Account has now been unlocked. Re-type your user short name on the website and proceed as usual.
An internal error occurred on the SecSign ID Server. If you are the admin please check the server logs else please contact the support.
There was an error when confirming biometrics on this device. Please use a password instead to secure your identity.
SecSign ID has crashed. Please send a bug report per email.
Can not connect to the server.
This username is already on this device. It was disabled and moved to trash. Do you want to delete the disabled ID and continue?
This username is already on this device. Do you want to delete the existing ID and continue?
"%1$s won't work unless you enable Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services which are missing from your device."
%1$s is having trouble with Google Play services. Please try again.
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services which are not supported by your device."
"%1$s won't run unless you update Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services which are currently updating."
New version of Google Play services needed. It will update itself shortly.
Could not connect to server because there is no network connection available.
You only entered the password once. Please retype the password in the second textfield.
The given username or the given password is wrong.
Awesome you have three SecSign IDs. For more IDs you will need an premium account.
In order to make room for new SecSign IDs you can delete some of the disabled SecSign IDs.

"Hi %1$s
please send this mail to get more IDs. Thanks for using SecSign ID.
My IDs: %2$s"
The address %1$s is not a valid server address.
This is the name which you will enter on the web site later on.
"The first passcode doesn't match the second passcode."
"The first password doesn't match the second password."

"The SecSign ID is protected by a passcode. The passcode is only used for the encryption of the private key. It will never be transmitted or stored.
You may choose a more complex password in edit mode later on."
Use the number keypad for faster and easier input.
Please enter the address of the required SecSign ID Server.
The passcode must consist of a minimum of %d digits.
The passcode must consist of a minimum of %1$d and a maximum of %2$d digits.
The password must consist of a minimum of %1$d and a maximum of %2$d characters.
The password must consist of a minimum of %d characters.
Cannot delete the device you are currently using. You can either delete it using another device having the same SecSign ID or you can lock the whole SecSign ID.
The device has been deleted on the server and cannot be used to log in any more.
Do you want to disable this identity?

"By providing your email address you will be able to suspend your SecSign ID and restore it on another device if your phone gets lost.
Please confirm this email address by clicking on the link in the confirmation email. If you don't receive an email in 5 minutes please check the spelling of your email address and your spam folder."
"Please check your email account and click the confirmation link. If you don't receive an email within 5 minutes please check the spelling of your email address and your spam folder."
A SecSign ID can be used on several devices. To do this the restoration function must be activated. This option allows for the management of all devices containing the ID.
The Email address for notifications and the restoration of the ID can be changed at any time.

Access to the SecSign ID app is protected with biometrics or the device PIN of the user. The private key is secured in the software independent Trusted Execution Environment of the device. This section of the device is separated from the operating system by hardware and can not be accessed by for example malware.

A key change can be initiated at any time for example after a system update. Both the private and the public key are deleted and a new key pair is generated. For on-premise SecSign ID server setups the key change can be initiated at any time either manually by the administrator or automatically for example after an update.

Access to the SecSign ID app is protected with an alphanumeric password. The patented SafeKey procedure secures the private key on the device and protects it for example from Brute Force attacks. The password is never transmitted or stored outside the device and thus can not be intercepted by attackers.

Access to the SecSign ID app is protected with a numeric PIN. The patented SafeKey procedure secures the private key on the device and protects it for example from Brute Force attacks. The PIN is never transmitted or stored outside the device and thus can not be intercepted by attackers.

"If the device with the SecSign ID is lost or stolen the ID can be restored on a new device. The restoration function must be activated on the native device first to use it on the new one. When activated you will receive a backup code that you need to store safely.
The restoration can also be used to duplicate the ID so it can be used on both devices at the same time.
You can activate the restoration and check your backup code anytime on the following screen."
Please activate biometrics or your device PIN/pattern/password.

I agree that my email address will be saved. The email will be used for the restoration to suspend an SecSign ID and to send SecSign system notifications to. You can delete your email at any time. This agreement is required by the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
Unfortunately an unexpected error happened. Please report this error to the support. Thank You
Add a description to your ID for internal specification for example \"WordPress\" \"privat\" or information about the used server. The description is not publicly accessible.
There was an error with the biometrics on this device. Please try again and contact the support if this problem persists.
This key is protected by a hardware TEE.
Logs copied to clipboard. You can now paste them into an email for example.
Create a SecSign ID on a third party server.
Restore or duplicate a SecSign ID.
There is no email client installed.
"Multiple simultaneous sign-in attempts with your user name have been detected. For security reasons this sign-in was suspended by the Server. Please try again."
Enter a new Email address for \"%1$s\"
SecSign ID: Mobile authentication for your website. Try and use it with our free secure messaging und cloud sharing portal too!
Restoration activated for \"%1$s\" this is your backup code:
Then take your smartphone and accept the login request
on your smartphone to the symbols on the website and tap on the correct one.
You have successfully signed in on the website using your SecSign ID!
Learn how to Sign In on a website using your SecSign ID
First choose a user short name:
You can choose any user kind your name email address your facebook name etc.
This is only to secure your SecSign ID key on your device and will never be transmitted.
"Great! That's it! You now have a new SecSign ID."
How to create your SecSign ID in three simple steps
No SecSign ID chosen and deleted.
No SecSign ID chosen and restored.
Restoration can only be enabled after setting an e-mail address. A code will be sent to this e-mail address during the SecSign ID restoration.
This SecSign ID cannot be restored since no e-mail address has been saved for it. Hence the validation code cannot be sent an no SecSign ID restoration is possible.
Restoration is disabled for this SecSign ID. You can enable it in the account settings of the original device.
"Unfortunately you can't use this app for security reasons. You need a supported device with secure hardware. Also you will need Android 6 and you will need to activate biometrics or the device pin."

There was an error reading the private key. Please try again and contact the support if this problem persists. If you have activated the restoration you can delete this identity and restore it afterwards.
Passcodes did not match. Try again.
Passwords did not match. Try again.
Use your SecSign ID for secure login and file sharing
Invite other IDs to share your files or provide external users with highly secure access links
Two-factor authentication encrypted transmission and storage and multi-level high-security architecture
in the middle of the screen.
Could not scan the QR code
This is not a valid SecSign QR code. Maybe you have scanned the wrong QR code?
"Use the QR code pairing for - On Premises OnBoarding - Atlassian OnBoarding - Restoration of IDs"
You can use biometrics for the login instead of the passcode. Would you like to see the possible options now?
In case you lose this device you will be able to restore your SecSign ID if you have its restoration code. Would you like to see the restoration options now?
The time for creating a 2048 bit key pair can take more than two minutes.
" This ID is no longer available and has been disabled."
Please make sure that you have a reliable network connection before sending the new key to the server.

"The confirmation email was resent. Please check your email account and click the confirmation link. If you don't receive an email within 5 minutes please check the spelling of your email address and your spam folder."
Restart authentication by tapping your SecSign ID in this app again.
The entered e-mail validation code has expired. Please start the restoration again.
Enabling restoration will allow you to restore your SecSign ID if you ever lose this device or password
You can now paste it to a password manager or print it and store it in a safe place.
Please write this code down and keep it safe. You will need it to restore your SecSign ID if you ever lose this device.
Please write down this code and keep it save. You will need this code to restore your identity on another device if you lose this one.
"Android App: Server can't send Email during Restoration"

"There was an error sending an email during restoration.
Email: %1$s Server: %2$s Date: %3$s SecSign ID: %4$s Device: %5$s Android: %6$s"

"The server can't send the one time code to your email at '%1$s'.
Please check if your email address is correct and fix it on the other device or by going to the dashboard/portal. Otherwise please contact the support."

"The server can't send the one time code to your email.
Please contact the support."
This is the name of your existing SecSign ID.
Please check your e-mail at %s and enter the validation code just received.
The SecSign App on your original device can show you the backup code needed here to authorize the restoration of the SecSign ID.
There is already a SecSign ID having the short name %s on this device. No need to restore it here.
There was an error saving the account data to disk.
SecSign App is out of Date
There is no email set for your SecSign ID \"%s\".
The email %1$s for your SecSign ID \"%2$s\" is not confirmed yet.

"An unexpected error happened while editing the ID. It seems to be a device specific bug unknown to us.
Please inform us at support@secsign.com so we can fix it."
SecSign Android App: error while editing the id

"With the biometrics authentication your key will be saved in the secure trusted execution environment of your device. For this reason your key won't be saved in a backup and will also be deleted if you disabled biometrics in the system settings. Thats's why we strongly recommend to activate the restoration for your ID if you have not done so yet."
The Email domain cannot start or end with a dot.
Email domain must contain at least one dot.
The Email cannot contain two dots in a row.
Email domain must not contain the character
Email must not contain the character
Your SecSign ID was locked because the maximum number of logins has failed. Please edit this ID and create a new key pair.
Your SecSign ID \"%s\" was locked because the maximum number of logins has failed. Please use the restoration function to use this ID again.
SecSign Android App: error while saving the private key

"An unexpected error happened while saving the private key. It seems to be a device specific bug unknown to us.
Please inform us at support@secsign.com so we can fix it."

"An unexpected error happened while using the biometrics authentication. It seems to be a device specific bug unknown to us.
Please inform us at support@secsign.com so we can fix it.
If you have activated the restoration for this ID you can delete it and restore it afterwards."
SecSign Android App: error while saving key with biometrics
SecSign Android App: error while switching to biometrics
The server closed the connection without returning a result.
Scan this QR code in the SecSign App on another phone to restore this SecSign ID
"Sign-In for '%1$s' at '%2$s' (%3$s) at %4$s failed due to: %5$s."
"Sign-In for '%1$s' at '%2$s' (%3$s) at %4$s was timed out."
"Sign-ins for '%1$s' had been suspended due to simultaneous sign-in attempts. Sign-in has been reactivated at %2$s"
Start a new sign in at the website you want to sign in.
Tap on the right access pass to complete your authentication. Try again.
The secure screen lock was disabled which invalidated the private key. Please restore this identity to use it again.
The certificate received from server is untrustworthy.
The decrypted secure key did not match.
The SecSign ID does no longer belong to this device.
The SecSign ID has been irrevocably locked.
The SecSign ID has been irrevocably locked. Please contact the support.
"My SecSign ID '%1$s' has been irrevocably locked."
The SecSign ID has been locked by the SecSign ID Server.
The SecSign ID Server did not understand this request.
The SecSign ID Server does not support this request.
The SecSign ID Server does not support this version of the SecSign ID App. Please update to the current version.
The server cannot process your request at the moment.
The server could not verify the validity of the key pair. There seems to be a problem with the biometrics. Please contact the support.
The server could not verify the validity of the key pair. There seems to be a problem with the biometrics. Please try again with a passcode.
The server has locked this ID because the maximum number of continuous authentication failures has been exceeded.
The server has locked this ID because the maximum number of overall authentication failures has been exceeded.
The server has suspended this ID due to the excessive number of failed key exchange attempts.
The server is down for maintenance and cannot accept requests from your device. Please try again later.
"The server sent an Error Code of: "
The server was unable to verify this device
The state of the server is still unknown.
The user short name must consist of a minimum of %d characters.
"There is no access pass for this SecSign ID. First start a new sign in on your computer."
This access pass does not belong to this SecSign ID.
This access pass has been rejected.
This access pass is unknown to the Server.
This access pass was cancelled by the requesting service.
This access pass was suspended by the server
This authentication attempt has timed out.
This sign-in does not belong to the SecSign ID.
This sign-in is unknown to the Server.
Go to www.SecSign.com on your computer and click on \"Try it now\".
Enter the short user name of your new SecSign ID.
Tap on your SecSign ID above.
The address ends with .coN but you probably meant .coM
The entered Restoration Code was wrong.
